Global Surrogate Model Specification

Source: R/mid_surrogate.R
mid_surrogate.Rd

mid_surrogate() defines a model that serves as a surrogate model of another target model. This function can fit classification (to be implemented) and regression models.

Usage

mid_surrogate(
  mode = "regression",
  params_main = NULL,
  params_inter = NULL,
  penalty = NULL,
  custom_formula = NULL
)

fit_mid_surrogate(
  x,
  y,
  weights = NULL,
  params_main = NA,
  params_inter = NA,
  penalty = 0,
  custom_formula = NULL,
  ...
)

Arguments

mode

A single character string for the type of model.

params_main

An integer for the maximum number of sample points to model main effects (k for main effects in interpret()).

params_inter

An integer for the maximum number of sample points to model interaction effects (k for interactions in interpret()).

penalty

A non-negative number representing the total amount of regularization (lambda in interpret()).

custom_formula

A formula object. If passed, fit() internally uses interpret.formula(), otherwise it uses interpret.default() (`formula` in interpret()).

x

a data frame or matrix of predictor variables.

y

a vector of target variable.

weights

an optional vector of case weights.

...

other arguments passed to midr::interpret().

Value

a mid_surrogate model specification.

Details

This function is the main specification for the parsnip model. The underlying fitting is performed by fit_mid_surrogate(), which is a helper function that connects parsnip::fit() to the midr::interpret() function.

See also

interpret
